intro: Alsinella saginoides, commonly known as the marsh hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers that resemble a cluster of small blooms. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its stems are erect and can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Alsinella saginoides plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and wildlife.
